intro: Henningia bucharica, commonly known as the Bukharan henningia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
